verses.roman:
tasmai namo bhagavate
kṛṣṇāyākuṇṭha-medhase
yan-māyā-mohita-dhiyo
bhramāmaḥ karma-vartmasu

synonyms: tasmai—unto Him; namaḥ—obeisances; bhagavate—unto the Supreme Personality of Godhead; kṛṣṇāya—Lord Kṛṣṇa; akuṇṭha-medhase—whose intelligence is never restricted; yat-māyā—by whose illusory potency; mohita—bewildered; dhiyaḥ—whose minds; bhramāmaḥ—we are wandering; karma-vartmasu—upon the paths of fruitive activity.
translation: Let us offer our obeisances unto Lord Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. His intelligence is never bewildered, whereas we, confused by His power of illusion, are simply wandering about on the paths of fruitive work.
